name: Joseph's Restaurant
address: 3 Hanover Square, New York, NY 10004, USA

reviews.text: Great food, great atmosphere and excellent service
Excellent food and service. Lindi is a great manager!

The service and friendliness was wonderful. I really couldnt find a red wine by the glass I liked. The Beet Salad special was a little odd tasting and I didnt like tje accomplishments for the crispy sea bass.
The ceasar salad was good, as was the veal piccata. I guess I just ordered the qring things.
It was also warm and cozy.
Great

Hidden GEM
FANTASTIC MEAL ...
EVERY BITE of  EVERYTHING
Baked Clams... AWESOME
Avocado Salad... AWESOME
BURRATA Salad ... AWESOME
CHICKEN MARTINI... FRIGGIN AWESOME
CHICKEN PARM... AWESOME
VEAL PICCATA... LIKE BUTTER - FRIGGIN
AWESOME
NO A BAD WORD
LOVE THIS PLACE
I like the tricolor salad. Salmon is good just no skin on
Amazing food and service! A must visit restaurant when in the city!
The hottest day in nyc June 2025. They turned the air off when kitchen closed. Last night I was at Stephina. Much better I will not be back!!!

I was unpleasantly surprised after going there with high expectations. Appetizers were really bad except the calamari. Pasta dishes were fine but not fine dining level. Over all it is a basic Italian restaurant with food below average

Upscale Italian restaurant with amazing atmosphere.
Our food was great!

We were here for our company party - the food was ok, but not in accordance to the prices. I had the chicken parm, which was ok, but for price, I would expect to be amazed. Everyone's food was good, but not great and for this price level there needs to be something - anything outstanding.

Haben hier zu Abend gegessen.
Das Essen war sehr gut! Alles auf den Punkt und Qualit√§t top!
Getr√§nke ebenfalls sehr lecker und der Service extrem schnell und aufmerksam!
Keine Wartezeit f√ºr irgendwas und es wurde jeder Wunsch sofort erf√ºllt!
Gerne wieder!

Not worth the money.
Food was average.
Service was great.
Food quantity and quality for the price not recommended.
Great Italian food. I had the pleasure eating there last week. The appetizers', dinner and desserts were fantastic.
An unexpectedly delightful meal with impeccable service in a classic old school Italian restaurant. Cozy interior, solid menu beautifully executed.

I ordered a sancocho soup and a chicken soup. Both tasted off. Like it was made the day before and the samcocho was watery not even thick. No meat never will I order from here again and I‚Äôve ordered multiple times. Whoever cooks definitely doesn‚Äôt know how to cook. Mofongo off soup off. The only maybe good thing is the mangu. Everything else save your money if you know what real good food tastes like.

The ambiance is amazing and if you love authentic dainty decor, you will love how the restaurant created a place that makes you feel like you‚Äôre in little Italy. The staff are second to none and was impressed how they deboned the fish before me. I could not fault the food neither the service. If you‚Äôre looking for good food, good service then I recommend you eat here. If I lived in NYC they would see me more frequently, I hope they have one in London.
It was great.
Food was excellent and service was above and beyond expectations!
Nice work.lunch spot. Quick and easy
This place is outstanding
Great ambiance, amazing food and anove all the best customer service. If yoy are in NYC Joseph‚Äôs is a must.

On Wall St for a business NYSE Closing, and felt like eating Italian food. The wife does not like seafood, and there are a few items on the menu that meet this need. She had the chicken Parm, and I had the sausage chicken. I thought mine was pretty good and serving size was ok. The wife felt the tomato sauce on the chicken Parm came from a can... Did not taste prepared, she also ran into a few pieces of the chicken that were fatty. The olives and bread were good, Limited selection on non-alcohol beverages. The waiters and waitresses were on top of it, and friendly. We felt a little out of place in jeans, as most of the customers in this place were in suits. They did ask if we had reservations, and seated us even though we looked a hot mess from traveling and did not have reservations. I guess we should suspect this from the financial district. We are from TX, here for business so I won't complain. If had the choice I would go back to Joseph's and try other plates, and their salads as they looked good. I would consider dressing up a bit though so we don't feel as out of place.

This was such an amazing find! The service is warm, and the food is exactly what you would hope it would be. The restaurant itself is very quaint and well apportioned, and you do not feel like you are sitting so close to someone that you could share food. It was a great place to have a quiet evening meal. Service was very prompt, and always made you feel welcome. The food itself was perfectly cooked and very well flavored. And given the fact that you can get a reservation last minute, you just can‚Äôt pass this place up. Joseph‚Äôs is definitely a hidden gym.

from the outside this place doesn't look inviting, but we descended the steep staircase anyway and were welcomed into a nicely appointed space and seated right away. what a surprise! everything from the complimentary olives and bread, the wine and the entrees were way better than we expected! I had the chicken scarpariello and Jenny had the eggplant parm and both were excellent! attentive and friendly service. this turned out to be one of the finest dining experiences we've had all year. thanks!
Such a surprise.   We didn‚Äôt have high expectations at all & yet it was just great!  The wait  staff was attentive & food rocked!  We will be back.
≈öwietna w≈Çoska (chocia≈º mo≈ºe nie do ko≈Ñca) restauracja. ≈öwietny ribeye, ≈õwietne wino (r√≥wnie≈º w≈Çoskie), ≈õwietna obs≈Çuga. Na pewno tu wr√≥cƒô. Polecam!
Delicious food, amazing service

We had an unfortunate experience at Joseph's and won't return. Despite having an early reservation, we were forced to sit next to a huge table of extremely LOUD men. These men were literally standing and screaming profanity at each other throughout the meal, all in good 'fun.' Our table of 5 could not even converse. There were other open tables, but our server refused to move us. The broccoli was mushy, our bill contained errors (overcharged), and we suspect we were served a cheaper substitute wine than the one we ordered (it came in a carafe, so we didn't see them pour it). When it came time to pay, they would only split the bill 4 equal ways for 5 people, leading to an awkward moment for our group. We all left disappointed with the food, service, and atmosphere. Never again.
Food was delicious, the stuffed calamari was amazing.
Nicht sehr ambitioniert

they gave some food to us that was $77 and was out of menu without telling us the price and also enforced us some 20% tip for a party of 1.
The service was also too soow
the Bass, it was delicious, skin was crispy and was just cook perfectly! Waiters were very efficient, definitely recommend.
Idk what I ate, but it wasn't Italian food.
refined environment and excellent cuisine in pure Italian style, the best restaurant in Manhattan

Joseph's Italian restaurant is a solid choice for anyone looking for quality Italian food in a relaxed setting. I recently visited and was impressed with a few standout dishes: Prosciutto, Burrata, and cacio pepe.
Everything about this place is great

We loved everything about this restaurant.  It has a very nice atmosphere,  the service is great with very attentive staff. I had the pork chops and have to say, it was one of the best pork chops I have ever had. My girlfriend had the mussels and she loved them. I highly recommend this restaurant.
Good atmosphere nice to hangout with friends
The best veal chop I ever had

Best Italian spot downtown no question. You can eat clean or you can eat fatty either way whatever you are looking for you will not be dissatisfied. Great people and service tell ‚Äòem blanco sent ya.
Tasty

Joseph‚Äôs is a quiet neighborhood Italian spot with great food and even better service! The mozzarella appetizer was great, the wine selection was also very good, and the gnocchi was homemade and delicious.

Disgusting that a restaurant would charge $12 for water. I have no problem paying for a great atmosphere but this place is just an over priced Olive Garden. The design is tacky and a $20 bottle of wine costs you $300. It‚Äôs laughable

No lo recomiendo el pan fr√≠o y duro y ni hablar de la pasta a la nonna que ped√≠ √≥sea estaba s√∫per s√∫per dura‚Ä¶ no importa el pago si se trata de calidad deber√≠an contratar chef para poder ofrecer comida de verdad

I do not recommend. I did come in thinking it was chef food, but the bread was hard and old, the antipasti was horrible and low quality. I felt scammed. I don‚Äôt mind paying for real good food, but this one is terrible and pricey. üòÇ service was great tho

Visiting town with relatives and tried this restaurant for lunch. Very nice inside, staff very professional.  Food was excellent.  The only thing that I found weird was when my check was brought to table for a party of 5, there was a 20% gratuity already added to the ticket.  I found it a little insulting as if they did not think that I was going to tip adequately but they short changed themselves because I was planning on tipping 30%.  Have only experienced that with large parties before.  Maybe it is a NY thing

Jedzenie - pyszne
Carpacio miƒôso dobrej jako≈õci i zimne
Makaron carbonara dobry
Crispy sea bas bardzo dobra
Tiramisu takie jak byƒá powinno :)
Obsluga - UprzejmƒÖ I profesjonalna

Warto tu zaj≈õƒá i spƒôdziƒá czas

La cena perfetta ‚Ä¶
We had the an amazing dining experience at Joseph‚Äôs. Astro and his team truly are world class restaurateurs. The food, service and our comfort level were perfect. It‚Äôs always nice to get treated like family, enjoy really tasty food and dine in comfort.
Grazie mille a tutti üíã

Tucked away in the bustling heart of NYC‚Äôs Financial District, Joseph‚Äôs Italian Restaurant offers a pre-fix dinner option within a setting that exudes comfort and a welcoming atmosphere. Its proximity to the lively Stone Street and the renowned Harry‚Äôs Steakhouse adds to its allure as a dining destination in FiDi. The interior ambiance strikes the right note for a pleasant dining experience, offering a respite from the urban rush.

My decision to dine at Joseph‚Äôs was influenced by the promise of a serene environment paired with the convenience of its location. However, while the setting met expectations, certain aspects of the service and culinary experience left room for improvement.

The service was adequate up until the conclusion of our meal, when the attentiveness of our server notably diminished. The prolonged wait to request our check, seemingly forgotten after our table was cleared, detracted from the overall dining experience. Furthermore, the presentation of my leftovers in a simple plastic ‚ÄòThank You‚Äô bag, placed unceremoniously on the table before dessert was even served, lacked the finesse one might expect from an establishment of Joseph‚Äôs caliber.

Culinary-wise, the dishes were satisfactory, yet unremarkable. The steak, requested medium, leaned towards medium-rare, verging on rare at its core. Additionally, a specific request to substitute the mushroom sauce due to allergies resulted in a plain, sauceless steak, rather than an alternative concoction from the chef. This oversight was disappointing and contributed to the overall oddity of the meal.

The dessert course brought its own set of mixed feelings. While the tiramisu I received was enjoyable, the portion size compared to my friend‚Äôs‚Äîvisibly about 20% larger‚Äîleft me feeling somewhat overlooked. Whether my slice was unusually small or my friend‚Äôs was generously oversized, it introduced a sense of inconsistency that marred the end of our meal.

The value proposition of dining at Joseph‚Äôs Italian Restaurant is debatable. While the location is undoubtedly prime, nestled within the FiDi area and surrounded by ample dining alternatives, the culinary and service missteps suggest that there‚Äôs room for refinement.

In conclusion, Joseph‚Äôs Italian Restaurant earns a solid three stars from me. It stands as a nice spot in the Financial District with potential for greatness, yet the inconsistencies in service, culinary execution, and the dessert disparity suggest that there is yet some way to go in fully realizing its promise.

What a gem!  We had a meeting a few blocks away, found this on Google Maps, it looked interesting with Northern Italian cuisine. Early on a Wednesday evening‚ÄîNo reservation no problem. Great service from the staff, (many from Albania) wonderful atmosphere. Joseph‚Äôs is a gem. Food was excellent. Wine was great. Service very friendly, and accommodating.

Nice Italian place with a really sweet ambiance. Nice and welcoming . Really cute bar, interesting service with so many people on the service, but a little disoriented. The one thing I don't like is when your waiter is topping up your glass with water every second, I get it, they want you to spend a lot of money on the expensive sparkling water, but common you cannot be that aggressive.
The food is good, nice pasta and appetizers, a great place to get together with coworkers and have dinner and a drink.
The food at Joseph's was exceptional, worth every penny! Service was superb & our waiter was excellent. My online birthday request for my gf was fulfilled with impeccable service.

Amazing restaurant. For valentines they have those amazing raviolis is shape of hearts üòç
Service is excellent. The main course - chicken had very very very tasty Sauce (‚Ä¶

Food was delicious.   Service was horrible.   We had to finally go to hostess and ask for our bill after we had sat there for 10 minutes after they emptied our table.  The manager brought 2 shots of tequila as an apology (which we did not want) but at least he made an effort.

Had an amazing time here at my friends rehearsal dinner. The space is beautiful and the food was fantastic. We had the whole place to ourselves on a Saturday which was also an added bonus. Will definitely be back to try other delicious food they have to offer

We found Joseph's looking for another place and decided to try it. What a nice surprise. Even though they had a big group celebrating the holidays, they served us like we were the only ones there. Later, some regulars arrived and were served in the same manner.

Amazing food and wine.

For an Italian restaurant in Wall Street area, this place is pretty awesome.  No need to go to Little Italy when it is this good. If you work in the Wall Street area and crave for Italian food, you must try this place.

Nice decor. Scrumptious food. Free homemade liquor tasting. Good atmosphere. One of us had the branzino, it is cooked whole and first delivered to the table then taken to the side to be de-boned and filleted and served again on a plate but still sizzling. Servers are very welcoming and courteous. Perfect place for groups.

The restaurant was one place who wants to have traditional Italian cuisine. I was confused between two dishes and Maria helped me choosee the right one. Enjoed my Lunch here. Awesome atmosphere to have a great time with some wine and of course don‚Äôt forget their tiramisu üòãüòãüòã

Had a delicious Pappardelle ai tre funghi that was absolutely amazing!
Very nicely decorated place, with wine bottles covering some of the walls. The place is  "hidden" from the street.
Didn't expect an Italian restaurant to have such delicious steak! Definitely a hidden gem of a restaurant that I will visit again. Lovely customer service also
Amazing! The service and the food was unparalleled- we will definitely be coming again!

After reading all the great reviews, I was excited to give it a try, but it was all together very disappointing.

The food was fine, not great. Pretty underwhelming and could have used a bit more seasoning. But for the price, I can‚Äôt knock it too much. The cappuccino was akin to drip coffee.

The service was so slow despite being late and one of only a few tables there. We sat for ages to even meet our server, and then again trying to find someone - anyone to bring us the check. When service was available, it was someone different literally at every interaction, which meant multiple people asked our drink order and we were never sure if that first person was already on it or if we should reorder.  Staff needs to communicate with each other.

When the check finally came, it has $50 worth of things we had never ordered, which felt like they were hoping we just wouldn‚Äôt notice.

The atmosphere was just bizarre. Visually it appears to be a nice classy Italian restaurant but the music was that of a  2000s club.

Had higher hopes. Won‚Äôt be back.

Absolutely FANTASTIC! I love the basement level of the restaurant, it gives off an intimate and speakeasy feel. The entire staff is wonderful. Very professional and welcoming. The food is amazing, the perfect comfort food of northern Italy. I highly recommend the grilled octopus to start. As a first dish the garganelli with meat balls (the pasta is homemade and cooked perfectly), for the mail dish the veal chop. And don‚Äôt forget to leave room for sorbet!

We had the best time here last night! We live locally but have never tried it. Last night we had the absolute pleasure of eating there. We sat at the bar and the food was delicious, the restaurant is beautiful and the bartender was 10/10. Music at the bar was so fun which was a pleasant surprise for an upscale NYC Italian restaurant. We can't wait to go back!

I recently had the pleasure of dining at Joseph‚Äôs Restaurant, and I must say, it was an experience to remember. From the moment I walked in, I was greeted with a warm and inviting atmosphere that set the tone for the entire evening.

The food at Joseph‚Äôs is nothing short of exceptional. I had the privilege of trying their branzino and hanger steak, and both dishes were a true delight for the taste buds.
The ambiance was enhanced by the lovely music playing in the background. The service was impeccable as well, with the staff going above and beyond to ensure that every need was met.

Whether you‚Äôre looking for a romantic dinner spot or a place to celebrate a special occasion, Joseph‚Äôs Restaurant is a fantastic choice.

This place exceeded my expectations. The staff was absolutely lovely, the food was great (the wine was exceptional!) like I expected and the vibe was relaxed even though everything felt upscale. I went with a friend and we had such a great time and I would go back with my husband for a night of romance too.

A first-class dining experience!

Started with a selection of appetizers - the grilled octopus was extraordinary, shrimp, burrata with prosciutto and figs,  and fried calamari, all recommended.  And the crispy sea bass is not to be missed.

This is old-world service and a level of professionalism that make dining a pleasure.  Highly recommend!!

I've visited Joseph's many times and the food has always been exceptional. Service is excellent. Restaurant is located below ground and you can feel a little claustrophobic/ cave dweller. However the food and service make it worth the trip.
